description:
Kasumi Toyama was enthralled by the stars as a young girl, so when she discovers a trail of star-shaped signs one day after transferring to a new school, she can't help but follow them. They lead her to a shop run by the grandmother of one of her new classmates, and Kasumi finds something that will change her life forever: a star-shaped guitar! And just like that, Kasumi knows that forming a band is her destiny.

Of course, convincing Arisa and her grandmother to sell her the guitar won't be easy, and finding a group of other girls who want to become musicians will be even harder. But when a girl has stars in her eyes and a starbeat in her heart, there's nothing that will stop Kasumi from making her fantasies come true!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

node.description:
[Official Website ](http://www.ariamusic.co.jp/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/agematsu)

Noriyasu Agematsu is the founding member of the musical group Elements Garden.

Along with his fellow Elements Garden members, he is the composer and arranger for the BanG Dream! franchise, including overseeing music production for its anime.

__[Profile](http://www.ariamusic.co.jp/elements-garden/fujita/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Junpei_Fujita)__

Member of the "music production brand" Elements Garden.

name.native: エレメンツ ガーデン

node.description:
__[Profile (Aria Entertainment)](https://www.ariamusic.co.jp/elements-garden/)__

A Japanese group of music composers, or a "music production brand" as they call themselves. They generally produce music for video games, anime and recording artists. They are attached to Aria Entertainment.

__Current Members:__ 
[Noriyasu Agematsu](https://anilist.co/staff/103633/Noriyasu-Agematsu) (Producer/Lyricist/Composer)
[Junpei Fujita](https://anilist.co/staff/110557/Junpei-Fujita) (Producer/Composer/Arranger)
[Hitoshi Fujima](https://anilist.co/staff/101273/Hitoshi-Fujima) (Composer/Arranger)
[Daisuke Kikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/147815/Daisuke-Kikuta) (Composer/Arranger)
[Seima Iwahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/146530/Seima-Iwahashi) (Composer/Arranger/Director)
[Ryutaro Fujinaga](https://anilist.co/staff/155960/Ryutaro-Fujinaga) (Lyricist/Composer)
[Ryota Tomaru](https://anilist.co/staff/140532/Ryota-Tomaru) (Composer/Arranger)
[Yuta Kasai](https://anilist.co/staff/259881/Yuuta-Kasai) (Composer/Arranger)
[Yusuke Takeda](https://anilist.co/staff/156645/Yusuke-Takeda) (Lyricist/Composer)
[Asuka Oda](https://anilist.co/staff/155968/Asuka-Oda) (Lyricist)
[Seima Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/239286/Seima-Kondou) (Composer/Arranger)

__Former Members:__ 
Yasutomo Nakai (2005-2006)
[Masato Nakayama](https://anilist.co/staff/112097/Masato-Nakayama) (2007-2013)
[Evan Call](https://anilist.co/staff/119999/Evan-Call) (2012-2016)
Tomohiro Kita (2011-2016), Haruki Mori (2009-2018)
[Ryouta Suemasu](https://anilist.co/staff/155969/Ryouta-Suemasu) (2014-2019)
_Note: Not to be confused with the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/256771/)._

Akio Takami is an animator, animation supervisor and character designer. Originally a member of Ashi Productions, he joined Xebec in the 90s, where he participated in most of Xebec's works and became one of the key people at the studio.

[Official Website](https://bushiroad.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kidanit)

Takaaki Kidani is a Japanese businessman. He is the founder and president of Bushiroad. Kidani has also served as the chairman of New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW). He continues to be involved with NJPW through Bushiroad, in which owns the company.

He founded Bushiroad in May 2007 as a company that produces card games and assumed the position of president. The origin of the name Bushiroad comes from the failure to make Neppu Kairiku Bushi Road into a film due to various reasons when he led the project in the days of Broccoli. The film was restarted in March 2013 with Kidani as the executive producer. The company would create numerous media franchises including Tantei Opera Milky Holmes and BanG Dream!
